lenders.name: 7Nature Usagi
lenders.occupational_info:
What is Powwow-aeaa Earth Kids project

SPIRIT / NATURE / TECHNOLOGY
Earth is one big family, made up of 6.8 billion human beings and 30 million kinds of living species. What can we do to save the beautiful earth for our kids in the future? Spirit, Nature and Technology, the three in harmony is what we need as we dive into the mid-21st century. To obtain this balance, we need to go beyond the differences in religion, race and ideaology, and get out of the materialistic way of living. Each of us needs to start relating directly to the world in our own way and remember to dream. Powwow is a Native American ceremony of dance and music. aeaa stands for Asia, Europe, Africa, and America. It is an important message that kids from around the world hand in hand, start to act together to save the earth for children yet to be born. The seven nature Usagi reck, hiki, ras, yang, divan, song, and haman are fighting for our earth, to shift our way of living to a more sustainable way. Powwow-aeaa Earth Kids Project is an art movement, children and grown-ups - by thinking and expressing ideas about the earth - get connected to the earth through art, creating a movement. 

Powwow aeaa Earth Kids Project Official HP
www.goldwin.co.jp/tnf/powwow/ 

Oak-to-all-relations HP
www.oak-to-all-relations.com

lenders.name: Roy
lenders.occupational_info:
About America’s Business Leaders:

America's Business Leaders is a human development company that was founded in 2005 by Roy Juarez, Jr, then a freshman at Hardin-Simmons University. Roy has always had a passion for working with the community. At the age of 12 he created and headed a community youth outreach program in San Antonio, TX. However, at the age of 14 Roy became homeless with a 9 year old sister and 2 year old brother, due to a violent divorce. After spending two and a half years as a “couch surfer” living in dozens of homes, he found a stable family that would take him in. Today, Roy speaks to audiences across the country and abroad, entering some of America's toughest neighborhoods with the hope that sharing his story will inspire and provide hope. He recently appeared on CNN with his mentor Lieutenant Colonel Consuelo Castillo Kickbusch, US Army (RET) in a segment leading up to Latinos in America. His spell-binding story has caught the attention of the well-established New York Times bestseller Chicken Soup for the Soul series. In August of 2009 Roy’s Story was featured in their latest book Chicken Soup for the Soul: Extraordinary Teens.

lenders.name: Emmie
lenders.loan_because:
My first loan was given to me as a bat mitzvah present. A bat mitzvah is a ceremony in the Jewish religion when a girl turns 13 and gets to for the first time in her life read from our holy book called the Torah. For a boy, this ceremony is called a bar mitzvah.

The best way to get a gift is to give a gift. I love knowing that I helped someone and giving back to the community , whether it's here in the United States, or Nigeria, or Cambodia, or Benin, or half way across the globe. I'm so glad that I can make a difference. 

When I loan, I try to stay as open minded as possible. Sometimes I don't really understand the full reason for someone wanting a loan, so I read about their reason and sometimes do my own research.
lenders.occupational_info:
How would you describe your work? (to someone across the world):

I am a student. I can't work yet because I'm under age. I can't wait to turn 16, because that's when almost all job opportunities open up! My first job will hopefully be volunteering at my local pet shelter, because I've always loved animals. They are so different from humans. Treat an animal right, and it'll give you its loyalty and friendship. What more could you ask for?
